main.name: Yang Zhou
main.description: I studied Petroleum Engineering at college and later found out my interest in coding. I started teaching myself web development during my free time and attended a coding bootcamp in 2020. In 2021, dream came true and I started working as a Software Enginner. Scroll down to check out more about my journey of becoming a developer
main.nowadays: I have been working as a Software Engineer since 2021. I spend most of my days immersed in devliering full-stack web products. I participate in architecutre design as well and solve business challenges using technical tools. I have grown into an indispensable teammate over the last year. Outside work, I take my skiils further by learning new technologies. I am also an avid fitness promoter and world traveller.
history: At 18, I graduated from high school and came to America on my own for the first time to attend college.
At 19, I transferred to University of Oklahoma because I wanted more affordable tuition and study in engineering
At 21, I started my first-ever job as a Undergraduate Researcher at University of Oklahoma.
At 23, I swore in to join the United States Army because I love the military lifestyle
19 - 24, I powered through undergraduate & graduate school in Oklahoma and graduated with honors. I also socialized a lot and made many life-long friends
At 25, I was called into active duty to be trained as a Biomedical Equipment Specialist for the Army in San Antonio, Texas.

At 26, I completed my training from the Army as the Honor Grad and started working for Philips Healthcare in New York. In the same year, I enrolled in Harvard Extension Schhol to formalize my learning as a software developer.
At 27, I quit my job at Philips Healthcare and enrolled at Code Platoon to learn full-stack web development.
At 28, I garduated from Code Platoon and landed my 1st Software Engineer job and started working as a full-stack developer.
main.contactmessage: Let's connect. A great way to get my attention is to send me an email or direct message me on LinkedIn.

resume.skillmessage: Here are the coding languages, frameworks and tools I am familiar with.

education.description: Over 600 hours of immersive [Full-Stack Software Engineering](https://www.codeplatoon.org/the-program/course-curriculum/#top) training. I learnt how to build web application from scratch using React and Django.

* [CSCI E-31 Web Application Development using Node.js](https://canvas.harvard.edu/courses/96093/assignments/syllabus)
 * [CSCI S-25 Image Processing and Computer Vision](https://pll.harvard.edu/course/image-processing-and-computer-vision?delta=0)
Graduated with honors from the nation's top-5 Petroleum Engineering program.

work.title: Software Engineer
work.description: Main contributor of a client-facing application which provides a seamless UI experience for users and reduces amount of time needed for onboarding new clients to use the firmâ€™s services.

work.title: Biomedical Equipment Specialist
work.description: Provide preventative maintenance and repair hundreds of various medical equipment used to support United States soldiers in critical missions all over the world.

work.title: Field Service Engineer
work.description: Performed preventive maintenance, repairs, tests and calibrations on a wide range of equipment for over 500 clinics in New York Metro Area. Also participated in setting up emergency hospitals during COVID-19 crisis in NY.

work.title: Waiter
work.description: Waited tables at a popular Thai restaurtant at the heart of the college town. It was fun during the football seasons. Polished my customer-relation skills.

work.title: Research Assistant
work.description: I spent a lot of time in the engineering lab performing rock-mechanics experiments and collecting data. I then used Matlab to do analysis on them to support ongoing researches. My graduate thesis was based on the experiments I performed.

work.title: Teaching Assistant
work.description: Taught graduate level classes, graded homework and hosted office hours for students. This was actually pretty fun, I got to see what it was like on the other side of the classroom.
